About me
---

3rd Year Graduate Student. Prior to my Ph.D. thesis I received a B.Sc. in Physics from Universidad Central de Venezuela, Venezuela in June 2012 and a M.Sc. degree in Physics from Universidad de Los Andes, Venezuela in January, 2014.

After obtaining a M.Sc., I held a three-year doctoral research position at the Universite de Franche-Comte - UFC, Besancon, France, supported by Centre National d'Etudes Spatiales (CNES) through PhD grant 0101973 and the R\'egion de Franche-Comt\'e and by the French Programme National de Cosmologie et Galaxies (PNCG).

My research interests include the study of Assembly history of the Milky Way. Chemical Enrichment of the Milky Way, Galaxy formation, Galactic structure, kinematics, and stellar populations, as well as the formation and evolution of the bulge, thick disk and the halo components of the Milky Way. The nature of secondary population and their connection with the intergalactic medium and globular clusters. The Origin of the runaway stars in the Milky Way, multiwavelength surveys (optical, infrarred, etc.), Galactic globular clusters. In addition, I am also a member of the SDSS-IV Science Collaboration.


 * Wide Field Spectroscopy
  * [SDSS-IV/APOGEE-2](http://www.sdss.org): Member of the Science Team, and leader of the project: [SDSS-IV-Project0184](https://github.com/Fernandez-Trincado/SDSS-IV-Project0184/blob/master/README.md), [SDSS-IV-Project0157](https://github.com/Fernandez-Trincado/SDSS-IV-Project0157/blob/master/README.md), and `SDSS-IV Project 0231`.

Contribution to Scientific Software, Code and other non-standard publications
----
* PhD. project dedicated to improvement the kinematics of the [Besancon Galaxy Model](http://model.obs-besancon.fr). I developed GraPot16 an extended collection of analytic/semi-analytic gravitational potentials for a double exponential disk with a central hole, boxy bar, hyperbolic secant squared thick disk, combined consistently with the mass model of all components including the dark halo and an additional central mass, in order to produce a more realistic kinematics model for the Besancon Galaxy model. The proposed package of potentials is computationally fast and has the potential to be applied to integrate and characterize orbits to interprete the upcoming six-dimensional phase-space data set produced by Gaia. Also, a review and update of atmosphere models has been done for low mass stars.

 * **Source on github:** [GraPot16](https://github.com/Fernandez-Trincado/GraPot16/blob/master/README.md)

* Since 2014, I am the administrator of several astronomical public programs and reduction pipelines written in Fortran and Python codes. 

 * **Source on github:** [Public repository](https://github.com/Fernandez-Trincado)
